hero.summary: I build modern, high-performance web applications. Passionate about clean code, scalable architecture, and exceptional UX. Always looking for the next technical challenge.
about.p1: I’m a technology-passionate developer with 2 years of experience building and optimizing web applications for complex industrial environments using Angular and .NET Core.
about.p2: I’ve worked on systems focused on performance, maintainability, and UX. I enjoy continuous learning and applying best practices: modular architecture, state management, and clean code.
about.p3: When I’m not coding, you’ll find me exploring open-source projects and experimenting with new tools. I believe the best solutions come from combining creativity with technical rigor.
about.cleanCode.title: Clean Code Advocate
about.cleanCode.desc: SOLID principles, design patterns, and code that reads like a story.
about.performance.title: Performance First
about.performance.desc: I optimize down to the last millisecond. Lazy loading, caching, query tuning, bundle optimization.
about.problemSolver.title: Problem Solver
about.problemSolver.desc: I enjoy breaking down complex problems into elegant and scalable solutions.
skills.subtitle: My main stack focuses on the Angular + .NET Core ecosystem.
exp.subtitle: 2 years of experience building and optimizing web systems for complex industrial environments, focused on performance and maintainability.
exp.0.desc: Developed and optimized web systems for complex industrial environments using Angular and .NET Core.
exp.0.resp.0: Led development of an internal IT team availability tracker used during holiday periods.
exp.0.resp.1: Mentored junior developers on reactive forms and Angular best practices.
exp.0.resp.2: Implemented dynamic admin forms (date ranges) and a calendar UI for users (daily availability).
exp.0.resp.3: Designed role-based API endpoints and improved performance: -25% response time (EF Core .AsNoTracking + indexing), +30% task transition speed (NgRx), -40% re-renders (OnPush).
exp.1.desc: Architected and began implementation of a scalable front-end foundation, focusing on stability, maintainability, and future feature growth.
exp.1.resp.0: Built the initial front-end foundation to support scalable feature development.
exp.1.resp.1: Joined stakeholder kick-off meetings to analyze the application flow and define next-version requirements.
exp.1.resp.2: Contributed to UX and process optimization by clarifying flows and requirements.
exp.1.resp.3: Established a maintainable baseline with structure, conventions, and quality gates.
exp.2.desc: Built a secure document management system for technicians and improved retrieval performance.
exp.2.resp.0: Developed a secure document management application for 100+ warehouse technicians.
exp.2.resp.1: Reduced retrieval time by 65% by caching frequently accessed drawings in the .NET Core API.
exp.2.resp.2: Optimized SQL Server queries through proper indexing and query tuning.
portfolio.subtitle: A selection of projects I’ve worked on — from enterprise applications to open-source contributions.
project.0.title: Team Management System
project.0.desc: Bachelor’s thesis project: interactive dashboards, drag-and-drop task board, JWT-secured API, and query optimizations (50% faster searches on indexed fields).
edu.subtitle: Continuous learning through formal education, online courses, and hands-on projects.
edu.degree: Bachelor of Computer Science - Software Engineering
